contextId.information: "to the 4th generation" or "for four more generations." This refers to his son, grandson, great-grandson, and great-great-grandson. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"Eighteenth" is the ordinal form of 18. AT: "the 18th year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the end of December on Western calendars. This is during the cold season when there may be rain and snow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
contextId.quote: in the tenth month, and on the tenth day of the month

contextId.information: This is the fourth month of the Hebrew calendar. The ninth day is near the end of June on Western calendars. This is during the dry season when there is very little or no rain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
contextId.quote: the ninth day of the fourth month

contextId.information: This is the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar. The seventh day is near the end of July on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
contextId.quote: in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month
